info.title: Blackbaud Raisers Edge NXT Gif
info.description: Blackbaud Raiser's Edge NXT is a comprehensive cloud-based fundraising and donor management software solution built specifically for nonprofits and the entire social good community. Use the Gifts connector to manage gifts.

get.description: Returns the first gift for a constituent.

parameters.name: constituent_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the constituent.

400.description: Returned when the specified constituent ID in the request URL is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the gift information.

404.description: Returned when the specified constituent is not found.

404.description: Returned when the specified constituent is not found.

patch.description: Updates the acknowledgement details for a gift.

parameters.name: acknowledgement_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the gift acknowledgement to update. It uses the parent gift's ID as its value.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the properties of the gift acknowledgement to update.

400.description: Returned when the specified acknowledgement ID in the URL or the specified request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to update the gift acknowledgement.

404.description: Returned when the specified gift acknowledgement is not found.

patch.description: Updates the receipt details for a gift.

parameters.name: receipt_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the gift receipt to update. It uses the parent gift's ID as its value.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the properties of the gift receipt to update.

400.description: Returned when the specified receipt ID in the URL or the specified request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to update the gift receipt.

404.description: Returned when the specified gift receipt is not found.

get.description: Returns a list of gifts.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: Defines a list identifier used to filter the set of gifts to those included in the specified list. If this value is set, other specified filters will be ignored.

parameters.name: gift_type
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of gift types to filter the results. For example, "MatchingGiftPledge,RecurringGift" returns only gifts of type MatchingGiftPledge or RecurringGift.

parameters.name: constituent_id
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of constituent system record IDs to filter the results. For example, "280,1232" returns only gifts from constituent 280 or constituent 1232.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of campaign system record IDs to filter the results. For example, "506,918" returns only gifts to campaign 506 or campaign 918.

parameters.name: fund_id
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of fund system record IDs to filter the results. For example, "506,918" returns only gifts to fund 506 or fund 918.

parameters.name: appeal_id
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of appeal system record IDs to filter the results. For example, "506,918" returns only gifts to appeal 506 or appeal 918.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 5000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

parameters.name: start_gift_date
parameters.description: Represents a filter for gifts with a gift date on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

parameters.name: end_gift_date
parameters.description: Represents a filter for gifts with a gift date on or before the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

parameters.name: start_gift_amount
parameters.description: Represents a filter for gifts with an amount greater than or equal to the specified amount.

parameters.name: end_gift_amount
parameters.description: Represents a filter for gifts with an amount less than or equal to the specified amount.

parameters.name: post_status
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of gift post statuses to filter the results. For example, "DoNotPost,Posted" returns only gifts that are marked as DoNotPost or Posted.

parameters.name: receipt_status
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of gift receipt statuses to filter the results. For example, "DoNotReceipt,Receipted" returns only gifts that are marked as DoNotReceipt or Receipted.

parameters.name: acknowledgement_status
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of gift acknowledgement statuses to filter the results. For example, "DoNotAcknowledge,Acknowledged" returns only gifts that are marked as DoNotAcknowledge or Acknowledged.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Represents a list of fields to sort the results by.  Results are in ascending order by default, and a '-' sign denotes descending order.  For example, "date_added,-date" sorts gifts by the "date_added" field in ascending order and then by the "gift date" field in descending order. If only the date_modified field or only the date_added field is provided, then this adds the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL to ensure that gifts are stably sorted.

parameters.name: date_added
parameters.description: Filter the results to gifts created on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

parameters.name: last_modified
parameters.description: Filter the results to gifts modified on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

400.description: Returned when the specified request parameters are not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view the gifts.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the gift to create.

200.description: Returned when the operation successfully creates a gift. The response body contains the ID of the new gift.

400.description: Returned when the request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to create a gift.

post.description: Add a gift to the specified gift batch.

parameters.name: batch_id
parameters.description: The batch to which the gift will be added.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the gift to add to the batch.

200.description: Returned when the operation successfully adds the gift to the batch. The response body contains a list of IDs and any exceptions that occured when adding the gifts.

400.description: Returned when the specified request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to add gifts to the batch.

get.description: List the gift batches.

parameters.name: batch_number
parameters.description: Represents a filter for results that match the specified number.

parameters.name: approved
parameters.description: Represents a filter for the status of the gift batch.

parameters.name: has_exceptions
parameters.description: Represents a filter for whether the gift batch contains exceptions.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 5000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

parameters.name: search_text
parameters.description: Represents a filter for text included in the batch description or batch number fields.

parameters.name: created_by
parameters.description: Represents a filter for gift batches created by the specified user.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have rights to view the set of gift batches.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the gift batch to create.

200.description: Returned when the operation successfully creates a gift batch. The response body contains the ID of the new batch.

400.description: Returned when the specified request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to create the gift batch.

GiftApi.AcknowledgementEdit.description: Acknowledgement letters foster relationships with donors and show appreciation for their contributions. It is important to keep track of the acknowledgement status of gifts to ensure that each one gets a well-deserved thank you.

status.description: The status of the acknowledgement.  When status is set to DoNotAcknowledge, letter and date should be null.  When status is set to NeedsAcknowledgement, date should be null.

date.description: The date associated with the acknowledgement (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

letter.description: The letter associated with the acknowledgement.

date.description: The date associated with the acknowledgement.

letter.description: The letter associated with the acknowledgement.

status.description: The status of the acknowledgement. Available values are: ACKNOWLEDGED, NEEDSACKNOWLEDGEMENT, and DONOTACKNOWLEDGE.

count.description: The number of items available for retrieval into the collection after applying any request parameters. The limit and offset parameters do not affect the count, but to facilitate paging, they may affect the number of items in the value result set.

value.description: The set of items included in the response. This may be a subset of the items in the collection.

count.description: The number of items available for retrieval into the collection after applying any request parameters. The limit and offset parameters do not affect the count, but to facilitate paging, they may affect the number of items in the value result set.

value.description: The set of items included in the response. This may be a subset of the items in the collection.

count.description: The number of items available for retrieval into the collection after applying any request parameters. The limit and offset parameters do not affect the count, but to facilitate paging, they may affect the number of items in the value result set.

value.description: The set of items included in the response. This may be a subset of the items in the collection.

count.description: The number of items available for retrieval into the collection after applying any request parameters. The limit and offset parameters do not affect the count, but to facilitate paging, they may affect the number of items in the value result set.

value.description: The set of items included in the response. This may be a subset of the items in the collection.

GiftApi.BatchGiftAddResults.description: Contains a collection of batch gift error records and the batch gifts that the operation added

errors.description: The batch gift errors associated with the batch gift add operation

gifts.description: The collection of batch gifts that were added by the batch gift add operation

GiftApi.GiftBatchGiftError.description: Represents exceptions preventing items from being added to the batch.

affected_field.description: The field affected by the error

batch_id.description: The system record ID of the batch

gift_id.description: The system record ID of the gift

lookup_id.description: The user-defined identifier for the gift.

batch_id.description: The ID of the batch to which the gift was added.

errors.description: The errors associated with the batch gift.

id.description: The system record ID of the batch gift.

constituent_id.description: The system record ID of the constituent associated with the gift.

amount.description: The monetary amount of the gift.

value.description: The monetary value.

balance.description: The balance remaining on the gift.

value.description: The monetary value.

batch_number.description: The batch number associated with this gift.

lookup_id.description: The user-defined identifier for the gift.

post_status.description: The general ledger post status of the gift. Available values are Posted, NotPosted, and DoNotPost. When post_status is set to DoNotPost>, post_date should be null. When it is set to NotPosted, post_date is required but remains editable. When it is set to Posted, post_date is required and is no longer editable.

post_date.description: The date that the gift was posted to general ledger.

reference.description: Notes to track special details about a gift such as the motivation behind it or a detailed description of a gift-in-kind.

recurring_gift_status_date.description: The date that the gift status was last modified.

d.description: The day in the fuzzy date.

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

frequency.description: Installment frequency of the recurring gift to view. Available values are WEEKLY, EVERY_TWO_WEEKS, EVERY_FOUR_WEEKS, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, ANNUALLY.

start_date.description: Date the recurring gift should start.

end_date.description: Date the recurring gift should end.

gift_aid_amount.description: This computed field calculates the total qualified amount of tax reclaimed from Gift Aid across all gift_splits for this gift. For the UK only.

value.description: The monetary value.

gift_aid_qualification_status.description: This computed field determines the Gift Aid qualification status based on tax declaration information and the database format. Available values are: Qualified, NotQualified, and PartlyQualified. For the UK only.

gift_code.description: The gift code value associated with the gift.

gift_splits.description: The set of gift splits associated with the gift.

fundraisers.description: The set of fundraisers who receive credit for the gift.

soft_credits.description: The set of soft credits associated with the gift.

receipts.description: The set of receipts associated with the gift.

acknowledgements.description: The set of acknowledgements associated with the gift.

linked_gifts.description: The identifiers of other gifts that are linked to this gift.

date_added.description: The date when the gift was created.

date_modified.description: The date when the gift was last modified.

id.description: The ID of the newly created gift.
The ID of the newly created gift attachment.
The ID of the newly created gift custom field.

name.description: The name of the custom field category.

type.description: The type of data that custom fields with this category represent.

GiftApi.GiftAdd.description: Gifts are the primary goal of fundraising efforts. They come in many forms and have a lot of information associated with them to ensure that they are properly allocated and acknowledged.

constituent_id.description: The system record ID of the constituent associated with the gift.

value.description: The monetary amount of the gift.

gift_splits.description: The set of gift splits associated with the gift.

check_number.description: The check number (only applicable when payment method is "PersonalCheck").

check_date.description: The check date (only applicable when payment method is "PersonalCheck").

d.description: The day in the fuzzy date.

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

reference.description: The payment reference (only applicable when payment method is "Other").

reference_date.description: The payment reference date (only applicable when payment method is "Other").

d.description: The day in the fuzzy date.

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

is_anonymous.description: Is the gift anonymous? If no value is provided, the default anonymity of the donor will be used.

reference.description: Notes to track special details about a gift such as the motivation behind it or a detailed description of a gift-in-kind.

lookup_id.description: The user-defined identifier for the gift.

batch_prefix.description: The prefix to use for batch gifts.  This must include at least one letter, and is required when 'Batch number' has a value.

batch_number.description: The batch number. Character limit: 50 (including the batch prefix).

post_status.description: The post status of the gift.

post_date.description: The date the gift was posted (ex: '2020-09-18').

origin.description: The origin of the gift. When provided, it must parse to a valid JSON object with one string field called "name". Additional fields may be added as desired.

status.description: The receipt status of the gift.

value.description: The monetary amount of the receipt for the gift.

date.description: The date that the gift was receipted (ex: '2020-09-18').

GiftApi.GiftAttachmentAdd.description: Many cultivation activities collect related collateral, such as correspondence and prospect research. Attachments can save this data on the appropriate record to maintain a complete view of those activities.

parent_id.description: The system record ID of the gift associated with the attachment.

type.description: The attachment type. Physical attachments are uploaded files such as images, PDFs, or Word documents that are saved locally or on the network. They are stored and managed in the system. Link attachments are links to files such as images, blog posts, or YouTube videos that are online or in a cloud storage account. They are stored and managed externally.

name.description: The name of the attachment. Character limit: 150.

date.description: The date of the attachment (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z'). This field defaults to the current date and time if not supplied.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. This is required for link attachments and not applicable for physical attachments.

file_name.description: The name of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

file_id.description: The identifier of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

thumbnail_id.description: The identifier of the thumbnail. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

tags.description: The tags associated with the attachment.

GiftApi.GiftAttachmentEdit.description: Many cultivation activities collect related collateral, such as correspondence and prospect research. Attachments can save this data on the appropriate record to maintain a complete view of those activities.

name.description: The name of the attachment. Character limit: 150.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. This is required for link attachments and not applicable for physical attachments.

tags.description: The tags associated with the attachment.

id.description: The system record ID of the attachment.

parent_id.description: The system record ID of the gift associated with the attachment.

type.description: The attachment type. Physical attachments are uploaded files such as images, PDFs, or Word documents that are saved locally or on the network. They are stored and managed in the system. Link attachments are links to files such as images, blog posts, or YouTube videos that are online or in a cloud storage account. They are stored and managed externally.

name.description: The name of the attachment. Character limit: 150.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. This is required for link attachments and not applicable for physical attachments.

file_name.description: The name of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

file_id.description: The identifier of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

thumbnail_id.description: The identifier of the thumbnail. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

thumbnail_url.description: The URL for a thumbnail. For physical attachments that are images only. Contains a time-bound signature that limits access to 60 minutes.

content_type.description: The content type. For physical attachments only.

file_size.description: The file size in bytes. For physical attachments only.

tags.description: The tags associated with the attachment.

GiftApi.GiftCustomFieldAdd.description: While records provide many fields to track information, organizations often require additional details. To track this specialized information, use custom fields.

parent_id.description: The system record ID of the gift associated with the custom field.

date.description: The date on the custom field (ex: '2005-09-18').

comment.description: The comment on the custom field. Character limit: 50.

GiftApi.GiftCustomFieldEdit.description: While records provide many fields to track information, organizations often require additional details. To track this specialized information, use custom fields.

category.description: The custom field category (required if updating the custom field value).

date.description: The date on the custom field (ex: '2005-09-18').

comment.description: The comment on the custom field. Character limit: 50.

id.description: The system record ID of the custom field.

parent_id.description: The system record ID of the gift associated with the custom field.

type.description: The type of data that the custom field represents.

value.description: The value of the custom field.

text_value.description: The text value of the custom field.

number_value.description: The numeric value of the custom field.

date_value.description: The date value of the custom field.

currency_value.description: The currency value of the custom field.

boolean_value.description: The boolean value of the custom field.

codetableentry_value.description: The table entry value of the custom field.

constituentid_value.description: The constituent ID value of the custom field.

fuzzydate_value.description: The fuzzy date value of the custom field.

d.description: The day in the fuzzy date.

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

date.description: The date on the custom field.

comment.description: The comment on the custom field. Character limit: 50.

date_added.description: The date when the custom field was created.

date_modified.description: The date when the custom field was last modified.

amount.description: The amount credited to the fundraiser for the gift.

value.description: The monetary value.

constituent_id.description: The constituent system record ID for the fundraiser associated with the gift.

id.description: The system record ID of the gift.

constituent_id.description: The system record ID of the constituent associated with the gift.

amount.description: The monetary amount of the gift.

value.description: The monetary value.

balance.description: The balance remaining on the gift.

value.description: The monetary value.

batch_number.description: The batch number associated with this gift.

lookup_id.description: The user-defined identifier for the gift.

post_status.description: The general ledger post status of the gift. Available values are Posted, NotPosted, and DoNotPost. When post_status is set to DoNotPost>, post_date should be null. When it is set to NotPosted, post_date is required but remains editable. When it is set to Posted, post_date is required and is no longer editable.

post_date.description: The date that the gift was posted to general ledger.

reference.description: Notes to track special details about a gift such as the motivation behind it or a detailed description of a gift-in-kind.

recurring_gift_status_date.description: The date that the gift status was last modified.

d.description: The day in the fuzzy date.

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

frequency.description: Installment frequency of the recurring gift to view. Available values are WEEKLY, EVERY_TWO_WEEKS, EVERY_FOUR_WEEKS, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, ANNUALLY.

start_date.description: Date the recurring gift should start.

end_date.description: Date the recurring gift should end.

gift_aid_amount.description: This computed field calculates the total qualified amount of tax reclaimed from Gift Aid across all gift_splits for this gift. For the UK only.

value.description: The monetary value.

gift_aid_qualification_status.description: This computed field determines the Gift Aid qualification status based on tax declaration information and the database format. Available values are: Qualified, NotQualified, and PartlyQualified. For the UK only.

gift_code.description: The gift code value associated with the gift.

gift_splits.description: The set of gift splits associated with the gift.

fundraisers.description: The set of fundraisers who receive credit for the gift.

soft_credits.description: The set of soft credits associated with the gift.

receipts.description: The set of receipts associated with the gift.

acknowledgements.description: The set of acknowledgements associated with the gift.

linked_gifts.description: The identifiers of other gifts that are linked to this gift.

date_added.description: The date when the gift was created.

date_modified.description: The date when the gift was last modified.

campaign_id.description: The system record ID of the campaign associated with the gift split.

fund_id.description: The system record ID of the fund associated with the gift split.

appeal_id.description: The system record ID of the appeal associated with the gift split.

package_id.description: The system record ID of the package associated with the gift split.

gift_aid_amount.description: The amount of tax reclaimed from gift aid for this gift split. For the UK only.

value.description: The monetary value.

gift_aid_qualification_status.description: The gift aid qualification status of the gift split. Available values are: Qualified, and NotQualified. For the UK only.

package_id.description: The system record ID of the package associated with the gift split.

GiftApi.ReceiptEdit.description: An object that represents the gift receipt to edit. To help donors track their giving for tax purposes, your organization should provide gift receipts.

status.description: The receipt status of the gift.  When status is set to NeedsReceipt or DoNotReceipt, receipt date should be null.

value.description: The monetary value.
The monetary value.

status.description: The status of the receipt. Available values are: RECEIPTED, NEEDSRECEIPT, and DONOTRECEIPT.

account_token.description: The tokenized account information (ex: credit card) from the external payment provider. Only applies to payment methods of "CreditCard" and "DirectDebit".

bbps_configuration_id.description: The BBPS configuration ID. Only applies to payment methods of "CreditCard" and "DirectDebit".

bbps_transaction_id.description: The BBPS transaction ID. Only applies to payment methods of "CreditCard" and "DirectDebit".

check_date.description: The check date. Only applies to payment method of "PersonalCheck".

d.description: The day in the fuzzy date.

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

check_number.description: The check number. Only applies to payment method of "PersonalCheck".

checkout_transaction_id.description: The checkout transaction ID. Only applies to payment methods of "CreditCard" and "DirectDebit".

payment_method.description: The payment method. Available values are listed below.

reference.description: The reference. Only applies to payment method of "Other".

reference_date.description: The reference date. Only applies to payment method of "Other".

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

value.description: The monetary value.

gift_id.description: The system record ID of the gift associated with the soft credit.

GiftApi.Virtual.BatchGiftAdd.description: Gifts are the primary goal of fundraising efforts. They come in many forms and have a lot of information associated with them to ensure that they are properly allocated and acknowledged.

gifts.description: Gifts are the primary goal of fundraising efforts. They come in many forms and have a lot of information associated with them to ensure that they are properly allocated and acknowledged.

constituent_id.description: The system record ID of the constituent associated with the gift.

value.description: The monetary amount of the gift.

gift_splits.description: The set of gift splits associated with the gift.

check_date.description: The check date (only applicable when payment method is "PersonalCheck").

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

y.description: The year in the fuzzy date.

reference.description: The payment reference (only applicable when payment method is "Other").

reference_date.description: The payment reference date (only applicable when payment method is "Other").

m.description: The month in the fuzzy date.

is_anonymous.description: Is the gift anonymous? If no value is provided, the default anonymity of the donor will be used.

reference.description: Notes to track special details about a gift such as the motivation behind it or a detailed description of a gift-in-kind.

lookup_id.description: The user-defined identifier for the gift.

post_status.description: The post status of the gift.

post_date.description: The date the gift was posted (ex: '2020-09-18').

origin.description: The origin of the gift. When provided, it must parse to a valid JSON object with one string field called "name". Additional fields may be added as desired.

status.description: The receipt status of the gift.
